module.name: lazdeviceapis
module.short: LCL APIs for accessing hardware sensors (such as Accelerometer, GPS, etc) and integrated elements of the system (such as Calendar, Contacts, etc)

element.name: TLazAccelerometer
element.short: Represents the hardware accelerometer

element.name: TLazAccelerometer.xaxis
element.short: The last value measured for the X axis of the accelerometer

element.name: TLazAccelerometer.yaxis
element.short: The last value measured for the Y axis of the accelerometer

element.name: TLazAccelerometer.zaxis
element.short: The last value measured for the Z axis of the accelerometer

element.name: TLazAccelerometer.StartReadingAccelerometerData
element.short: Starts monitoring the accelerometer sensor

descr.p: After calling this method, the accelerometer sensor will be monitored. If the accelerometer native API sends an event for value changes, then the event OnSensorChanged will be called on every change and before calling it the xaxis, yaxis and zaxis properties of the Accelerometer global object will be updated to reflect the last value read. If the native accelerometer API requires pooling, then the accelerometer state will be pooled at a rate not faster then once per millisecond.
Remember to call StopReadingAccelerometerData when the accelerometer is no longer needed, because this may save energy in some mobile platforms.

element.name: TLazAccelerometer.StopReadingAccelerometerData
element.short: Stops monitoring the accelerometer sensor

descr.p: After calling this method OnSensorChange will no longer be called and the xaxis, yaxis and zaxis properties will remain stopped at the last value read

element.name: TLazAccelerometer.OnSensorChanged
element.short: Called when the accelerometer value changes or is updated from the sensor

element.name: TLazDeviceMessageKind
element.short: Indicates the type of message (for example: SMS, MMS, EMail)

element.name: TLazDeviceMessageKind.dmkSMS
element.short: Indicates that the message is a SMS

element.name: TLazDeviceMessageKind.dmkMMS
element.short: Indicates that the message is a MMS

element.name: TLazDeviceMessageKind.dmkEMail
element.short: Indicates that the message is a E-Mail

element.name: TLazDeviceMessage
element.short: Represents a message
element.descr: Don't create instances of this class directly. Instead use Messaging.CreateMessage().

element.name: TLazDeviceMessage.bccAddress
element.short: A copy should be sent to addresses specified here, but these addresses will not appear in the message
element.descr: The BCC field of E-Mails, also known as hidden copy

element.name: TLazDeviceMessage.Body
element.short: The main text of the message

element.name: TLazDeviceMessage.ReplyToAddress
element.short: Might indicate an address different from SourceAddress so that replies are sent to a different address then the message sender
element.descr: By default this value is empty, which means that the source and reply-to addresses match.

element.name: TLazDeviceMessage.ccAddress
element.short: A copy should be sent to addresses specified here

element.name: TLazDeviceMessage.destinationAddress
element.short: The destination(s) of the message

element.name: TLazDeviceMessage.isRead
element.short: Indicates if the user has already read the message

element.name: TLazDeviceMessage.messageId
element.short: Reserved field

element.name: TLazDeviceMessage.messageType
element.short: The type of the message

element.name: TLazDeviceMessage.sourceAddress
element.short: The address from which the message was sent

element.name: TLazDeviceMessage.Subject
element.short: The title or subject of the message

element.name: TLazDeviceMessage.Time
element.short: The time when the message was sent

element.name: TLazDeviceMessage.validityPeriod
element.short: The period of time for which the message is valid

element.name: TLazMessagingStatus
element.short: Indicates the current stage of a message sending operation

element.name: TLazMessagingStatus.mssSentSuccessfully
element.short: Indicates that the message was sent successfully to the server

element.name: TLazMessagingStatus.mssSendingGeneralError
element.short: The message was not successfully sent to the server, but no particular reason for the failure is known.

element.name: TLazMessagingStatus.mssRadioOff
element.short: The hardware device which would send the message is off. The user should activate his Radio Network (CDMA, GMS or another one) or activate his WiFi (for EMail only)

element.name: TLazMessagingStatus.mssNoService
element.short: The hardware device which would send the message could not connect to the network because there is no signal here.

element.name: TLazMessagingStatus.mssReceivedSuccessfully
element.short: The message was succesfully received by the destionation

element.name: TLazMessagingStatus.mssReceivingGeneralError
element.short: The message was not successfully received by the target, but no particular reason for the failure is known.

element.name: TOnMessagingStatus
element.short: A produral type to receive the events of the status of sending a message

element.name: TLazMessaging
element.short: A class which manages messages

element.name: TLazMessaging.SendMessage
element.short: Sends a message to the target specified on it

descr.p: The message to be sent should be created with the method CreateMessage from this same class and later released with FreeMessage. The same message can be sent multiple times, but ideally it should not be edited after sending the first time to avoid confusion when obtaining the message object back in the status callback.

element.name: TLazMessaging.CreateMessage
element.short: Creates a new message which can be sent with SendMessage

element.name: TLazMessaging.FreeMessage
element.short: Removes a message created with CreateMessage

element.name: TLazPositionMethod
element.short: A list of possible positioning methods

element.name: TLazPositionMethod.pmGPS
element.short: The GPS positioning method

element.name: TLazPositionMethod.pmNetwork
element.short: Detects the position via the network connection

element.name: TLazPositionInfo
element.short: Represents the hardware GPS device

element.name: TLazPositionInfo.IsPositionDataAvailable
element.short: Indicates if position info was read in the life of this program

element.name: TLazPositionInfo.accuracy
element.short: The horizontal accuracy of the position in meters

element.name: TLazPositionInfo.altitude
element.short: Altitude in meters in relation to the sea level using the World Geodetic System 1984 (WGS84) datum

element.name: TLazPositionInfo.altitudeAccuracy
element.short: The vertical accuracy of the position in meters, or zero if not available

element.name: TLazPositionInfo.latitude
element.short: Latitude in degrees using the World Geodetic System 1984 (WGS84) datum

element.name: TLazPositionInfo.longitude
element.short: Longitude in degrees using the World Geodetic System 1984 (WGS84) datum

element.name: TLazPositionInfo.longitude
element.short: In meters / second

element.name: TLazPositionInfo.timeStamp
element.short: The time when the latest location was established

element.name: TLazPositionInfo.RequestPositionInfo
element.short: Requests the latest position using the given method
element.descr: This call is assynchronous and the data will only be available when the OnPositionRetrieved callback is called.

element.name: TLazPositionInfo.OnPositionRetrieved
element.short: Called asynchronously when the position is read

element.name: Accelerometer
element.short: A global object representing the accelerometer of the device

element.name: Messaging
element.short: A global object to manage message

element.name: PositionInfo
element.short: A global object which represents the positioning sensor of the device
